sources.data_found: Triton Supercomputer: IBM Power System AC922; 96 compute nodes; each node contains 4 NVIDIA Tesla V100 GPUs.
Pegasus Cluster: General purpose cluster with ~250 Intel CPU nodes. Mentions 'GPU nodes' generally but no specific model/count listed on public spec sheet.
2022 Degrees Awarded in Computer Science: 87 Bachelors, 19 Masters, 3 Research Doctorates.

student_data.notes: Exact current enrollment figures not listed on CS department 'About' page. Counts estimated based on DataUSA/IPEDS 2022 degree completion data. Undergrad estimated as Degrees Awarded (87) × 4.5 years duration ≈ 391. Grad (MS) estimated as Degrees (19) × 2 years ≈ 38. PhD estimated as Degrees (3) × 6 years duration ≈ 18.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: The Pegasus cluster documentation mentions the existence of GPU queues/partitions, but specific hardware counts (likely older K80 or P100) are not publicly enumerated on the IDSC specifications page.

gpu_resources.notes: Primary GPU resource is the 'Triton' cluster managed by IDSC. Calculation: 96 IBM AC922 nodes × 4 V100 GPUs per node = 384 Total V100s. No public documentation found for newer A100/H100 installations as of May 2025.

analysis_notes: University of Miami relies heavily on the IBM Power9 'Triton' system for AI/GPU workloads. While newer clusters may exist internally, public documentation only verifies the V100-based Triton system.
